channel.title: Trition Framework!
channel.description:
I've basically given up on login, I'll have to read up on it a little more before I even attempt it again. But, this server has some content. We've (The development team) have started on some content, you can look at it when you download the server.
The server is also ticking at 600ms, just because 500ms doesn't cut the chase. If I remember correctly it's because the client updates the player or the players region every 600ms (or something like that). - `SJ_
Everything technical is handled via the constants class. You can check most of the features/code out yourself when/if you download it and continue working on it.
Download - http://www.mediafire.com/?gt32j91yz3x6yvk
Mirror - http://up.ht/pU27N9
Credits (No particular order) - `SJ_ Smokin Flax AtomicInt_ Uncalled

item.title: Trition Framework!
item.dc:creator: @sinisoul sini
item.description:
@sinisoul wrote:

Did you know that if you run a server at 100 ms update periods it will update the player on the client at 100 ms update periods!

And there are some unholy to hell things in here that made me cringe that I don’t want to point out because it will take to long. Work on your OOP programming skills and develop a better style than trying to create a mixture of wL, Runesource and RS2HD.

I can tell this is your first walk in the park in the realm of trying to develop a framework.

List of WTF’s:

package triton.logging;

import java.text.SimpleDateFormat;
import java.util.Date;


/**
 * @author Integer_
 */

public class logger {
	
	public static Date date = new Date();
	public static SimpleDateFormat sdf = new SimpleDateFormat("hh:mm:ss");

	public static void log(Object classname, String string) {
		System.out.println("[" + sdf.format(date) + "]["
				+ classname.getClass().getSimpleName() + "]" + string);
	}
}
/**
	 * Gets the region x coordinate.
	 * @return The region x coordinate.
	 */
	public int getRegionX() {
		return (x >> 3) - 6;
	}
	
	/**
	 * Gets the region y coordinate.
	 * @return The region y coordinate.
	 */
	public int getRegionY() {
		return (y >> 3) - 6;
	}

This is more of a personal issue.

package triton.model.combat;

/**
 * 
 * @author AtomicInt
 */

public class combatManager {

	public static boolean isFighting() {
		return false;
	}

}
public void SpawnData(int id, Object create) {
		// TODO Auto-generated constructor stub
	}

…what is the create parameter for?

I could keep going on but you get the point, the code looks bloated to say the least and no apparent design structure is present.

Read full topic

item.description:
@Uncalled wrote:

[quote=“eyeownyew, post:19, topic:417793”][quote author=jmood128 link=topic=520337.msg3778948#msg3778948 date=1318299444]
500ms can cut the chase… Rune-Source was able to update 2000 players in less then 50ms… I think 500ms is a very reasonable mark for any server that isn’t a bunch of shit code combined into a shit server…
[/quote]
50ms delay. No server would ever attempt running on less/more than 600ms if they are attempting to be an rsps.[/quote]I agree, I’d only stick with just 600ms

Read full topic

item.title: Trition Framework!
item.dc:creator: @Scape-JAVA Scape-JAVA
item.description:
@Scape-JAVA wrote:

[quote=“eyeownyew, post:13, topic:417793”][quote author=`SJ_ link=topic=520337.msg3778783#msg3778783 date=1318292546]

it’s running on 600ms…[/quote][quote author=smokin flax link=topic=520337.msg3778728#msg3778728 date=1318291132]
The server is also ticking at 600ms, just because 500ms doesn’t cut the chase. If I remember correctly it’s because the client updates the player or the players region every 600ms (or something like that). - `SJ_

And for some reason you tried 500ms…

it’s ticking at 600ms, well it should be.

And yet, you still tried 500ms. You aren’t understanding what I’m saying here.
Where did you possibly get the idea of trying 500ms intervals? That would offset everything in the entire game.
Edit:[quote author=smokin flax link=topic=520337.msg3778777#msg3778777 date=1318292416]
My bad, that was all me. I wasn’t thinking, but he quickly corrected me <3
[/quote] Mmh. K.

Are you retarded? I didn’t even attempt to tick at 500ms intervals…Ever since I started just fooling around with my framework 3 months ago I’ve had it ticking at 600ms intervals.
[/quote]
I’m 100% sure you tl;dr’d me[/quote]

I’m 100% sure you tl;dr’d the main post. Re-read it, and if there is an instance thats ticking at 500ms, it was smokin not me.

Read full topic
